C67F93938A28412D8522DC64CA72CADB.description:
Describe the advantages and disadvantages of emerging technologies in
business and commercial contexts.

C0D547E247B9402BA8CFF440280AC6CA.description:
Be aware of current and emerging technologies in business and commercial
contexts

F1392B5A08564EC6AF0CE304C5EB72A6.description:
Suggest methods for prevention or reducing the risk of potential health
hazards

784C17E687404E72BCD54DA33F12D9E2.description: State potential health hazards when using computers.

5F13D590CB2A47BE8EF275106F02C9B8.description:
Know : how to protect data from accidental destruction; how to protect data from deliberate damage caused by viruses and
other types of malicious damage; how to protect stored or transmitted data from unauthorised access.

139C3CBC9ECC4FBA99172F023FBF519B.description:
Discuss appropriate steps to avoid inappropriate disclosure of personal
information.

5A912A66CBB94EFA971FC6355DBB4871.description: Understand codes of conduct for personal protection

1D5E81D8EF8840D9A09BF4AD0BA7C432.description: Understand the dangers associated with: the disclosure of personal data; misuse of images; Data protection issuesusing inappropriate language

10B2BEB23C8C4C9A84F12665BF0559BD.description: Identify new crimes created and the implications for computer users

A0A4F100BFF14B959050D74E56049953.description:
Know and understand the: provisions of the Data Protection Act (DPA) 1998
o rights of the data subject and the holder
o exemptions from the DPA; Computer Misuse Act 1990; Electronic Communications Act 2000; Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000; Health and Safety legislation; issues concerning copyright misuse

541B8418768249628C5D8562666FFBD6.description: Understand issues relating to: employment patterns; retraining; changes in working practices (collaboration); teleworking; homeworking; videoconferencing; the environmental impact; the impact on rich and poor communities; emerging technologies.

ED233BA989644FB1A6E356D68C70CB32.description:
Reflect critically on the impact of ICT on their own and others' lives,
considering the social, economic, political, legal, ethical and moral issues.

EB919AAE9D124EB1AEBFAFE142F55D03.description:
Know and understand: physical protection e.g. back ups; restricted physical access e.g. biometric scans; restricted access to data e.g. hierarchy of passwords and access
rights, encryption; monitoring e.g. transaction logs.

FBF5473673DF4FA2BBF525216FE2D609.description: associated with each of the following organisations or applications: banking; e-commerce systems; payroll; modern mail handling methods; control processes(feedback); robotics and bionics; Artificial Intelligence (AI) and expert systems

F2305810C24C4BF4B3D4CA01A6D917E4.description:
Describe: suitable data, file or database structures; suitable computer systems including data capture, output and
communication devices; suitable software tools and techniques used in the processing and
presentation of the data; suitable verification, validation and security and back-up systems

E80AA4DB4C9749E2A9CA422CE0E3D621.description:
Know: how data is captured, checked and entered; which processing method is used, i.e. batch, real time, real time
transaction; what the minimum hardware and software requirements are; how the information is output; what the security implications are.

F725990992AC4CD0B78B5F2A30CD3442.description:
Demonstrate a knowledge and understanding of a variety of computer
applications.

D8F0F1336B354886906E095F5FB48A8B.description: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of each HCI.

73D6402E16A9440293458E6D3BF49AC3.description:
Recognise and describe the features and uses of the different types of user
interface including: command line; GUI (graphical user interface)
o WIMP (windows, icons, mouse/menu, pointer)
o office assistants, online tutorials
o customised desktops; voice driven applications;  menu/dialogue boxes; touch sensitive applications e.g. mobile phones, learning aids and
PoS systems; biometrics e.g. retina, DNA, fingerprints, walking, etc.

BB151311683D4AE09BF05F72981C3C54.description: Understand the functions of an operating system

A2E03F7DB125452EA13EF461D5953B93.description: Understand and describe: integrated point of sale (PoS) systems; automatic stock control systems.

E726B38AE9FE405FA39B858D1B08C32E.description:
Compare the advantages and disadvantages of network systems against
standalone computers.

856EBA222C424F7494094EE8A9B04AF7.description: Understand and describe computer network operation and devices such as: network topologies including bus, star and ring; Internet / Extranet / Intranet; routers; switches; gateways; bridges; packet switching.

E700F34718124DB59D0CE71ADB84805A.description:
Appreciate the differences between local (LAN) and wide area (WAN)
networks.

B4807F85AE944CC5AA867CB96D698250.description:
Understand the use, advantages and potential disadvantages of different
formats such as wav, wma, mp3, etc.

6EA48A2394794343BEAD5D4AF16DBC2F.description:
Discuss potential problems in the capturing and use of sound with respect to
copyright

D098521ED5F046199417091C8AA43F0F.description: sound conversion analogue to digital and digital to analogue; sequencers (multitrack recording studios); notators (music composition software);  Sound Wave Editors; downloading music.

1A412EF4A23A4A3EA5D5F59AE60E63AA.description: sound storage devices e.g. MP3 players; sound cards; input devices such as microphones and Midi interfaces; speakers

03E09CF63D9048A69627164F37558AB8.description:
Understand their use and advantages and potential disadvantages of different
formats such as gif, cgm, png, etc.

5857262BA0C240B3B350E4C7167A8D3C.description: Understand: the impact of variety of frame rates and looping; vector and bit map animation; claymation and pixilation techniques; rotoscoping; tweening and onion skinning; grouping, cloning, backdrops.

9A796E704820488C9DC8C2B61D7223C5.description: Plan an animation: folder trees, story boards

40BC7D9BB2E54407B0DF1BC00BA7B17F.description:
Tools and techniques for
creating animated images

E485A04AB6594109B8708E77BC006BE4.description:
Describe advantages and disadvantages of animation in commercial and
educational environments

894057799EEA443EBB890AFF945DF763.description: Understand: film making and special effects industries; VLEs, educational websites; animations for the web; identification through logos; standard banners for web pages/leader boards

FC103E755BF54953BAE6847CFAEBED86.description:
Uses in commercial and
learning environments

0D411ACF459B4F41961B34C07E78B328.description: Understand: persistence of vision techniques;  flip books ; stop Motion animation; flash/Key frame animation;  3D animation.

1EC7948C3B71455582D05FC648D4D023.description: Compare and contrast different animation techniques

A634ADF223BE40C989C49FC0DD4F3946.description:
Understand the use, advantages and potential disadvantages of:
bmp, jpeg, gif, tiff, eps and other common formats

4690CDA21CD0438EABBED9EB18A26927.description:
Use: standard tools: zoom, selection, transforming, scaling and sizing,
brush settings, distortion, moving, cloning, rotation, layering, toggling
between layers; colour effects, colour palettes and gradient tools; imaging effects; transparency effects; composite patterning (repeated patterns)

FE5D5B599B74490D8451D67E571D23D8.description: Describe advantages of vector graphics over bit mapped graphics

BFCFECB056A842B2B0292E5CB7E97C8C.description:
Tools and techniques for
creating and manipulating
still images

4785D755015A432BAF060C7444657953.description:
Understand screen resolution and memory requirements for different
backgrounds (transparent, white, colour).

268D7F849A5D4A97AFCBBE33511E1971.description:
Understand pixel dimensions (pixels per inch/cm) and benefits and problems with
resizing of images for optimum use

FF8EEA59CBC04BD4A118E85596F0B262.description:
Understand vector and bit map graphical techniques and their implication for
memory size and manipulation

C5D0786B47DE442EB859EBDE67AD7D26.description: Describe advantages and disadvantages of such techniques.

768FD27D8FCA497DADF77953D2C80E3C.description:
Discuss differences between techniques for storing text, images, sound and
video

38A628D63D2B4B88BD66C31A5378AEB6.description: Describe advantages and disadvantages of using multimedia software.

0A807195925F4B11A02E21016002325C.description: Understand and make appropriate use of: internal memory and backing store digital photographic editing; movie making; animation; music; sound; keyword searches; quizzes; questionnaire; games; links.

B2F56E7C0A624CC485681EA0A61968B1.description:
Understand the requirements of multimedia systems in terms of: screens: size and resolution; input devices: mouse, graphics tablets, touch sensitive input devices,
microphone; features of digital still and video cameras, webcams, different
megapixels; Midi and other specialist input or output interfaces.

C8D4C089C11B4E3592A623BBD23ADC4B.description: Demonstrate an awareness of current and future trends in multimedia

F21DFD5A35CB47849D531341DE4D9FE3.description:
Demonstrate an understanding and awareness of current developments in
the multimedia industry and their effects on: education; entertainment;  business; society

B11A8D8FC7A7439BA88CC590CC4CA3B4.description: Describe advantages and disadvantages of presentation software.

E8BBE4595E5643999ADC4DCB99483B6D.description: Understand and use: design templates; animation; transitions and timings; video and sound; navigation bookmarks, hyperlinks and hotspots; narration and speaker notes; printing formats

CF33CDA248C44594A361507EA6F69502.description: Describe advantages and disadvantages of: the use of web pages and the different features used on them; RBG colours; decimal and hexadecimal code used for colour

D8A1A0303104457986379A752CC03DAF.description: Discuss issues with hosting of websites and factors affecting uploading times

C1F096DD39DF410A970E7E836B1C7C17.description: Understand and use: master pages/templates; home page; site navigation; golden triangle; hyperlinks; graphical hyperlinks/hotspots/rollover buttons and polygon links; bookmarks/ anchors; navigation bars; leader boards; banners; web icons e.g. shopping trolley, email; html.

51B9C4CE35544AF78FB89C22C475E109.description:
Tools and Techniques for
creating websites

657C71ABE64447F7AF9516C6602EE1E8.description:
Use interactive features such as online forms, email, games, quizzes and
questionnaires.

4EC81F1CEB5F491D9BE2961986A1B152.description: Make comparisons on house style, audience, size and techniques used

6F8ADA4EBE504500AF3DE4F2E1EF07D4.description: Search for and search on web pages

0E20C35106204437BA111D59CB718AAD.description:
Understand browser software:
 url
 keyword searches
 links
 menus.

33DF548E162E4544A78F70E61361ED11.description:
Describe advantages and disadvantages of data compression techniques for
images, movies, sound, pages and slides.

3F9974391186494685B4B7FEF7B5FF45.description:
Understand the appropriate use of good practice in designing web and slide
presentations including: sequencing instructions; animations; transition; links; consideration of target audience; appropriate use of standard navigation techniques; disability considerations e.g. sound, font style and sizes, pop up
comments on images

E382FF682ABB48919342F03894A1D4B2.description:
Recognise, use and where appropriate evaluate techniques such as: changes in font type, style and size; justification (left, centre, fully justify); importing different file formats e.g. clipart, csv, txt, rtf, etc. ; tabulation; tables; borders; single and double line spacing;  manipulation of graphics such as resizing, cropping, rotating and
mirror imaging; autoshapes; watermarks.

F0A6104898424D289B0A86632A2E03F5.description:
Understand the purpose and use of the following: spellchecker; online thesaurus; mailmerge; automatic routines such as: style sheets, headers and footers,
pagination and automatic contents production.

1A9A17CA5E084C568D9A9F3B426B8BD7.description:
Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of:
 computerised data logging
 computer control (non feedback and feedback)

E0FC99EDCA124A36A6C9FE766135B46A.description:
Understand:
 the process of data logging
 different types of sensor and suitable uses for them
 how to write a sequence of instructions to control a screen image or
external device appropriately
 the use of ICT to control and monitor areas of everyday living such as
electronic toys, games, central heating systems, burglar alarms,
smart meters, security systems, automatic doors, traffic control
systems, car parking systems, greenhouse control systems and
robotics, simulation (for example flight or driving)

900AC288A1FD4B358DB02DE3C4B07261.description:
Understand the benefits of using spreadsheets for: changing information in a spreadsheet model to make and test
predictions (What if investigations); generating different charts and graphs from suitable data; accurate calculations; auto recalculation.

80DD4ADEF77C40D99F3FE987D945B10E.description:
Understand: the difference between labels, data and formula;  formulas and functions to calculate information such as SUM,
AVERAGE or IF; absolute and relative cell referencing; appropriate formatting techniques e.g. borders, currency; cell merging.

4CFC28AB6A6C4677A199921CA327E197.description:
Understand appropriate measures to prevent misuse e.g. viruses, abusive
language

85C9CD9F76184E8D83B2D4FB4866D3A5.description: Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of using email in regards to security

3C003F95BF3D4BC6961435FDD7C8D90C.description: Understand how to: create an email; create a standard outgoing signature and message; send the email to one other email address; send a group email; use cc and bcc; use file attachments;  forward mail to another email address; create and manage an address book; create and save contacts; organise and name email groups and folders.

88D13B98DD9D4EA9A1E39CED6D06C4BF.description: Understand: password protection and password protocols; access rights to data; backup procedures.

C287319AD56C45B58D041E0B19162B88.description: Understand the benefits of using information handling for: faster access to data;  variety of output formats; data integrity.

8D3E7B99B1654653A921FF6ADEFD1E40.description:
Understand: the outputting of data in report formats how simple calculated fields are produced the purpose and suitable application of validation techniques such as
'lists', 'range checks', 'format checks' and 'input masks' for common
fields

8F6CEFD30C8545AAA4BF17F818038AC3.description:
Search for information using tools such as search engines, keyword
searches, etc.

0AA90DA604444FB0B2C5F9E072868A4E.description: Recognise and understand the purpose of the 'key field'

A14E1C7CD034459F92F07FBBB549E4AD.description: Identify fields and records in a file

FE04948BB73C4058AE60EC5F93600A9C.description:
Have a basic understanding of data type including number, text, date, time,
currency, Boolean, lists, picture, sound, video.

DA29167F7CA44274B30603BB92FA6754.description:
Understand the appropriate use of operators including = , < >, < , >, 'AND',
'OR', 'LIKE'.

67BDD7CE47274AB8B196C3CDCEFCE0E8.description: Know when it is appropriate to: update or delete records;  sort information into Descending and Ascending order;  search for information using single and multiple criteria.

F881C977A776494C96E253DCE2281C36.description: Understand the purpose and appropriate use of applications software.

18674E258857477C83850908EFE27BDC.description:
Understand and identify suitable sources of information, including files on
disks, CD-ROMs, databases, the Internet.

F58893FEC05B4481BF5BB9BC0AE191B3.description: Software to support learning disabilities Online and distance learning services: Understand the uses of: voice recognition software; text to voice software; customised desktop environments

F4C3608797E943D49E83050F5B0180A8.description: Understand the uses of input devices such as: braille keyboards; specialist devices such as microphones; touch sensitive data entry devices.

7CEEA90B524540119D3FA60216139DE7.description: Understand the features of and the advantages and disadvantages of: online tutorials e.g. BBC bitesize; online assessment e.g. examinations;  Virtual Learning Environments (VLEs)

654667CCC4C84576B3428C908E800752.description:
Understand how to manage the desktop environment including features such
as: adjust window size, mouse settings, icon size, screen resolution,
desktop fonts, colour, position, graphics, contrast and volume to meet
their own needs;  move, copy, delete, rename, files and folders; on-screen help; features of a control panel; print settings; password protection;  shortcuts.

F7166B37728043D2B7C611F4A4BB1273.description: Understand and describe the advantages and disadvantages of: school registration systems; management information systems in schools; data logging in school activities; weather forecasting systems

98EDD5D844484855B3C603D789B2FE32.description:
Describe advantages and disadvantages of online booking and shopping
services

03B838F9653B4516A39B880C9F31BE77.description: Understand the use of computers when carrying out: online shopping and searching for products on websites; booking online; verification (passwords and online data entry forms)

5018DBBD7C7F45A0817E3451157D1EE7.description: Describe the benefits, advantages and disadvantages of these technologies

D6B226D3D00A45D3992972E8D6E62272.description: Understand: wireless; bluetooth; other emerging connection technologies; geographical Information systems (GIS

0A381DFF5A3A469E83C90C6AE59CD91A.description: Understand how computers can be connected to the Internet: broadband; satellite; mobile communication; dial up; cable

C6C87EF25F3A4976B325F3B7EBBC018C.description: Describe the advantages and disadvantages of each of the above services.

F73CF3950C904E2CAD6DD2A8F93C40A4.description:
Understand the use, services, input and output devices used with:  interactive TV pay-to-view services, interactive services, e.g.
shopping, betting, voting, dating gaming: online and games consoles basic digital photography: technology of capturing, storing and simple
manipulation of images including cameras, megapixels, flash
memory, display devices and photo editing software; webcam services, social networking: Information needed to create accounts, services
available, music and sound including downloading from the Internet and related
issues ; mobile phones.

A97A997F2A1146ADADEEB24182ADBFDE.description: Understand the techniques used to overcome these errors

302C76312FDE4A95AFFC942F07E84239.description: Understand the possible sources of error which could exist

E3C28E264F3E4B19AC702371562256BB.description:
Describe Validation: o batch totals
o hash totals

D5F3962B6D9E4F609D3C152346C80B29.description: Describe Verification: o parity check o double keying o visual check

BE43DE1DDF144AA586C1FC1C2862F891.description:
Identify  potential types of errors and understand methods for minimising the
risk of errors

520B97486ECE43CFAA4CB0FD217E39C2.description: Identify data validation techniques for single user and online systems such as range checks, format checks, presence checks and check digits

E9481CE037BD4403AEDABFEA2C727015.description:
Know the methods used for validation and verification and where they are
appropriate

96F7D206DA7F4D7E99181BBFFACE421D.description:
Understand the advantages and disadvantages of using Information and
Communication Technology for storing data

97C804486E18455F869FA30B276D5FFB.description: Understand the improved speed of access to data

52DA36BD21914B2BBEBA8EDEEC11C7EE.description: Understand the potential benefits of encoding data and the reasons for doing it

57EC1BF22BD34148BADCBFE6F9143412.description: Understand the need for good quality data; G.I.G.O. (Garbage In, Garbage Out)

F185A816489B442095DB0D992D354AA9.description: Understand that knowledge is derived from information by applying rules to it

2B9E119B752645CCAE1AD48F1389AC1E.description: Understand that information is data which has been processed by the computer

3AEC1261864A427DB801B286EB45EDEC.description:
Understand that data consists of raw facts and figures e.g. readings from sensors,
survey facts, etc

CEF68B6B3D29477AA5716872FF3F808C.description: Evaluate data for fitness for purpose, accuracy and bias.
